A filter plugin was added to allow for a url to be parsed for the
purpose of pinning to an origin.

The PPA being used for modern rsyslog is exhibiting signs that its
prone to failure. Upon further review the V8 stable PPA is tied
directly to launchpad which is a known failure domain. To correct
this issue the PPA was removed and the additional repo from within
the rsyslog_* roles was made optional.

This is the recommended solution per the upstream mariadb
documentation as found here:
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/installing-mariadb-deb-files/

Partially implements: blueprint master-kilofication

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I503054e27425231b1d40a695786f8ce049f78d53
(cherry picked from commit ab0a5e7e5585f887f17938d5f0f222c0a56e54b4)
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-04-23 05:07:49.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/plugins/filters/urlfilters.py', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/galera_pin.pref.j2', 'playbooks/roles/rsyslog_client/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/templates/galera_client_pin.pref.j2', 'playbooks/roles/rsyslog_client/tasks/rsyslog_client_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rsyslog_server/tasks/rsyslog_server_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/ansible.cfg', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/tasks/galera_client_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/rsyslog_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix the package pinning problem within the roles

The package pinning issue in galera is related to how the pref file

the extra packages.

A filter plugin was added to allow for a url to be parsed for the
purpose of pinning to an origin.

The PPA being used for modern rsyslog is exhibiting signs that its
prone to failure. Upon further review the V8 stable PPA is tied
directly to launchpad which is a known failure domain. To correct
this issue the PPA was removed and the additional repo from within
the rsyslog_* roles was made optional.

This is the recommended solution per the upstream mariadb
documentation as found here:
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/installing-mariadb-deb-files/

In the horizon kilo play the package pathlib is required when doing
an offline compress however this package is not a "requirement"
according to the horizon requirements.txt file though within our
implementation horzion needs this dep.

Partially implements: blueprint master-kilofication

commit_message:
Fix the package pinning problem within the roles

The package pinning issue in galera is related to how the pref file
or the lack there of is being created. The pref file for apt pinning
needs to be locked down to the release organisation which is providing
the extra packages.

A filter plugin was added to allow for a url to be parsed for the
purpose of pinning to an origin.

The PPA being used for modern rsyslog is exhibiting signs that its
prone to failure. Upon further review the V8 stable PPA is tied
directly to launchpad which is a known failure domain. To correct
this issue the PPA was removed and the additional repo from within
the rsyslog_* roles was made optional.

This is the recommended solution per the upstream mariadb
documentation as found here:
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/installing-mariadb-deb-files/

In the horizon kilo play the package pathlib is required when doing
an offline compress however this package is not a "requirement"
according to the horizon requirements.txt file though within our
implementation horzion needs this dep.

Partially implements: blueprint master-kilofication

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I503054e27425231b1d40a695786f8ce049f78d53
(cherry picked from commit ab0a5e7e5585f887f17938d5f0f222c0a56e54b4)

This patch sets the pin-priority to 1010 as a release option which
tells apt that the packages from a given repository that provides
for the release option should always be perfered over anything
else. This also creates an origin pin with a pin-priority of 1001
that sets the preference to an apt repositories from a known source
as defined within the repo. These changes will resolve MariaDB
pinning issues while also allowing us the ability to change repos
and ensure that apt does the right thing by not forcably installing
packages that could potentially force a general downgrade of other
system libraries that end up breaking everything from the bottom up.

commit_message:
Fix the package pinning problem within the galera roles (juno)

This patch sets the pin-priority to 1010 as a release option which
tells apt that the packages from a given repository that provides
for the release option should always be perfered over anything
else. This also creates an origin pin with a pin-priority of 1001
that sets the preference to an apt repositories from a known source
as defined within the repo. These changes will resolve MariaDB
pinning issues while also allowing us the ability to change repos
and ensure that apt does the right thing by not forcably installing
packages that could potentially force a general downgrade of other
system libraries that end up breaking everything from the bottom up.

This is the recommended solution per the upstream mariadb
documentation as found here:
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/installing-mariadb-deb-files/

A filter plugin was added to allow for a url to be parsed for the
purpose of pinning to an origin.

The setup play for safe upgrade that runs first was removed from
host-setup.yml as its not needed and causes an unprecedented
number of gating issues.

Change-Id: I59eae19cef8a19bd61e58f690de775233ed6e128
Closes-Bug: #1446772

Remove dsvm from ansible commit job

The ansible stuff doesn't run on a devstack VM, so the name is rather
misleading.

commit_message:
Fix the package pinning problem within the galera roles (icehouse)

This patch sets the pin-priority to 1010 as a release option which
tells apt that the packages from a given repository that provides
for the release option should always be perfered over anything
else. This also creates an origin pin with a pin-priority of 1001
that sets the preference to an apt repositories from a known source
as defined within the repo. These changes will resolve MariaDB
pinning issues while also allowing us the ability to change repos
and ensure that apt does the right thing by not forcably installing
packages that could potentially force a general downgrade of other
system libraries that end up breaking everything from the bottom up.

This is the recommended solution per the upstream mariadb
documentation as found here:
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/installing-mariadb-deb-files/

A filter plugin was added to allow for a url to be parsed for the
purpose of pinning to an origin.

The setup play for safe upgrade that runs first was removed from
host-setup.yml as its not needed and causes an unprecedented
number of gating issues.

Change-Id: I59eae19cef8a19bd61e58f690de775233ed6e128
Closes-Bug: #1446772

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

commit_message:
Bump pymemcache to >= 1.2.9

This version adds in thread safe client pools
which avoid sharing the same socket (which previously
if any thread or green thread shared the same client
they would share the same socket, which would end
badly).

Change-Id: I660f6c21aef0bca7b3b2adf1374919a685668301

commit_message:
Bump python-saharaclient to 0.9.0

The new release adds support for:
* keystone sessions
* regions
* job-types list
* event log
* volume to instance locality

Several patches waiting saharaclient updates:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158715/ - support for event logs in
  horizon
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176690/ - use keystone session in
  integration tests

Change-Id: I2a69fc3235da787cdec1839003a0c525e3cf7217

Make status column on admin network table translatable

The status values in the admin network table are hardcoded
to English. They need to be translatable.

commit_message:
Remove dead vmrc code

It appears vmrc_manager is never used.  It even includes a config
option that doesn't exist (console_vmrc_error_retries).  So even
if it was used it would fail if ever called.

Change-Id: I2c40b99e921c452813e27b74b2162cd3d814c74d

commit_message:
Create logvol /var/lib/docker and balance usage

Modified Fuel Master partition schema to match
the following schema:
  * swap            default
  * /               10gb
  * /var            10gb + 30% of remaining free space
  * /var/log        4gb + 50% of remaining free space
  * /var/lib/docker 17gb + 20% of remaining free space

Effectively, the following partition changes are made:
  * Reduce /var to 30% of remaining free space (was 60%)
  * Increase /var/log to 50% of remaining free space (was 40%)
  * Add new logvol /var/lib/docker (17gb + 20% remaining)
  * Raise minimum disk size to 41GB

This new logvol will prevent docker from running out
of disk space because of logs, diagnostic snapshots,
or Fuel backup.

Change-Id: I79b0ebfeeddbef67e4c7c1650b6cdc2b8ea96937
Closes-Bug: #1415946
Doc-Impact: ops

commit_message:
Adding a guideline template

This change adds a template which should be used for new guideline
proposals to the repository.

Changes
* adding template.rst
* adding the template to the index
* adding a paragraph to the process document about proposing a new
  guideline

Change-Id: Ic040d535a519969d402cc44af7874a27f58940d9

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

commit_message:
Fix bug in trigger for initialize_tables()

Previously, triggers were not executed when data was inserted
into the policy engine via initialize_triggers().

This change adds the trigger execution logic to the initialize_tables
path for inserting data into the agnostic policy engine.

Also make the trigger removal process more robust to errors and eliminate
triggers that hung around after they were deleted.

Closes-bug: 1447338
Change-Id: Ibcb5d9c43c2a15ba81b1f03a89f3aadea0c7a33e

commit_message:
Sync oslo-incubator code

Sync common code from oslo-incubator. The main reason for it is removal
of usage 'log' module from incubator in manila codebase. Because we already
use another 'log' from library 'oslo_log'.

Head of oslo-incubator code that was used for 'sync' operation was at
following commit:

commit f5646edc61b9653d7ff71ed0177ed77811bbdcd0
Author: Elena Ezhova <eezhova@mirantis.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 7 17:46:16 2015 +0300

Additional changes:
- Added explicit registration of 'oslo_log.log' options to all manila scripts
- Module 'manila.openstack.common.log' removed as unused

Change-Id: I5b98d3863329227531fdb94ad7dbf5b3e5c51141

commit_message:
change the reboot rpc call to local reboot

Instances fail due to the reboot operation using the rpc call,
because the rpc call can fail due to the network impact.
Due to  the rebooted instances are just at the current host,
There is no need using the rpc call to reboot the instance.

Change-Id: I3d435cf9ca5f722ed3fc4325e7331f29a73198d5
Closes-bug:#1439493

commit_message:
Override update_available_resources interval

Add a config option 'update_resources_interval' to be able to set how
often the update_available_resources periodic task should run.

When a single nova-compute is managing a lot of nodes, we need the
ability to tune the frequency of this task.

The default value of 0 means to run on every periodic task interval
(same as current/old behavior). Setting it to a negative value will
prevent it from running at all. Setting it to a positive value will
determine the number of seconds between calls.

DocImpact
This adds a new CONF option 'update_resources_interval' that controls
how often the update_available_resource() method is called.

Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>

Change-Id: I8986d8d97dbf348e219c5f1f0a62092115c096d5

subject: NetApp cDOT driver clones NFS export policy
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 13:28:50.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/protocols/test_nfs_cmode.py', 'manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/protocols/nfs_cmode.py'], 'message': "NetApp cDOT driver clones NFS export policy

When clustered Data ONTAP clones a flexvol, the clone gets the
NFS export policy of its parent. Manila expects the clone to be
independent of its parent, so it should be given its own export
policy. This isn't happening in the Kilo cDOT driver.

Change-Id: I5067fc5729bec62de19d1aeaed7ed60d2224e498
Closes-Bug: #1446369
(cherry picked from commit b907ca09f13389f8ac3fa059785c1d1e644f85bf)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver clones NFS export policy

When clustered Data ONTAP clones a flexvol, the clone gets the
NFS export policy of its parent. Manila expects the clone to be
independent of its parent, so it should be given its own export
policy. This isn't happening in the Kilo cDOT driver.

Change-Id: I5067fc5729bec62de19d1aeaed7ed60d2224e498
Closes-Bug: #1446369
(cherry picked from commit b907ca09f13389f8ac3fa059785c1d1e644f85bf)

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Note: This is part of importing of translations, there are no new
translations for this project, thus only the pot file gets updated.

Change-Id: Ie8f8eb52a474818093f869063937391402ca7525

subject: Have eventlet monkeypatch the time module
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 14:06:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/cmd/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Have eventlet monkeypatch the time module

Without this, mongod retry logic in the various services started as
commands fails to behave as expected and does not reconnect as soon as
the mongod service has returned to availability.

In addition to the mongod sleep there are two other time.sleep calls
that may be reached by this change. Review and discussion with others
indicates that their behavior will continue to be correct with the
monkeypatch in place.

Change-Id: I4eca290acc3b06658951f070935ebb39936e13d3
Closes-Bug: #1447599
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have eventlet monkeypatch the time module

Without this, mongod retry logic in the various services started as
commands fails to behave as expected and does not reconnect as soon as
the mongod service has returned to availability.

In addition to the mongod sleep there are two other time.sleep calls
that may be reached by this change. Review and discussion with others
indicates that their behavior will continue to be correct with the
monkeypatch in place.

Change-Id: I4eca290acc3b06658951f070935ebb39936e13d3
Closes-Bug: #1447599

commit_message:
Disable and mark heartbeat as experimental

Due to some discovered issues since heartbeat is enabled by default.
Specially #1436788, that needs to fix the underlying library, too.
So, according to the discution here:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1436769/comments/10

We decide to mark the implementation as experimental and disable it by default.

Related-bug: #1436788
Related-bug: #1436769
Change-Id: Ib7c55977f976bdbbc8df4ad5915e0433cbf84a17

commit_message:
Remove known conflicting packages in the AIO bootstrap

Due to the OpenStack CI images having conflicting packages installed in the
base image, this patch also includes the removal of these packages during the
AIO bootstrap to ensure that the deployment succeeds.

For environments where the same two packages are installed on the hosts prior
to the deployment of os-ansible-deployment, they would need to ensure that the
packages are removed first. This has been seen in environments where
monitoring tooling has installed the packages as a dependancy.

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I83dda553dec9b7652d8463c426b2de6724ba78f2
(cherry picked from commit 66cdfc555c16ed0887ba04ed6e91334da20060da)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 05:57:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Restrict subnet create/update to avoid DHCP resync

As we know, IPs in subnet CIDR are used for
1) Broadcast port
2) Gateway port
3) DHCP port if enable_dhcp is True, or update to True
4) Others go into allocation_pools
Above 1) to 3) are created by default, which means if CIDR doesn't
have that much of IPs, subnet create/update will cause a DHCP resync.

This fix is to add some restricts to the issue:
A) When subnet create, if enable_dhcp is True, /31 and /32
   cidrs are forbidden for IPv4 subnets while /127 and /128 cidrs are
   forbidden for IPv6 subnets.
B) When subnet update, if enable_dhcp is changing to True and there are no
   more IPs in allocation_pools, the request should be denied.

Change-Id: I2e4a4d5841b9ad908f02b7d0795cba07596c023d
Co-authored-by: Andrew Boik <dboik@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1443798
(cherry picked from commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restrict subnet create/update to avoid DHCP resync

As we know, IPs in subnet CIDR are used for
1) Broadcast port
2) Gateway port
3) DHCP port if enable_dhcp is True, or update to True
4) Others go into allocation_pools
Above 1) to 3) are created by default, which means if CIDR doesn't
have that much of IPs, subnet create/update will cause a DHCP resync.

This fix is to add some restricts to the issue:
A) When subnet create, if enable_dhcp is True, /31 and /32
   cidrs are forbidden for IPv4 subnets while /127 and /128 cidrs are
   forbidden for IPv6 subnets.
B) When subnet update, if enable_dhcp is changing to True and there are no
   more IPs in allocation_pools, the request should be denied.

Change-Id: I2e4a4d5841b9ad908f02b7d0795cba07596c023d
Co-authored-by: Andrew Boik <dboik@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1443798
(cherry picked from commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde)

commit_message:
Handle socket.error's in mDNS

This ensures we don't log stacktraces for conditions outside
of our control, like a remote client closing the connection
abruptly.

Closes-Bug: 1437699

commit_message:
Move the Central rpcapi update_status to cast

Moves the update_status call (used by pool manager) to a cast.

Pool Manager doesn't actually do anything with the return value,
and causes another choke point.

Closes-Bug: #1445129

Change-Id: I385c950964b4b4374b2a4b5bfbd70e5b151dc813

commit_message:
PM: Ensure only one periodic task runs per host

Ensure multiple periodic sync/recovery tasks do not run concurrently on
a single host by using an inter process lock inside the periodic task.

This has the effect of serializing the tasks, rather than the more correct
deduplication of tasks. Bug 1445127 tracks the longer term fix.

Change-Id: Ib0041f127aacfd0f49ca84deecc2a6950594dd58
Closes-Bug: 1445125

commit_message:
Add check for nodes provisioning to BaseDeploySelectedNodes handler

In some cases (e.g. user is using CLI or API interface for deployment
of standalone controller node for cluster in ha mode) not all nodes
intended for deployment are yet provisioned. Separate validator added
for check such situation.

Change-Id: I7405ba54d90f6bc986befb5d035b213e4c0f6a73
Closes-Bug: #1415968

commit_message:
Update the deprecated group/name to Kilo release

For Kilo release, there are many deprecated group/name in conf files of openstack,
so we need to change the deprecated group/name to new group/name.

blueprint conf-section-update-for-kilo
Closes-bug: #1436170

Change-Id: Iec23f1b98fbf0c0772df7aba6ece9e0b32a85dc1

commit_message:
Publish infra docs to docs.o.o

The old ci.openstack.org server is not puppetted, and it's well past
time it was actually retired. Infra docs are one of the last things that
exist there that need to exist there. Move them.

Change-Id: I51a86699a39e6f8fdac91ad91f5933246681ae15

commit_message:
Include client recipe in controllers

For testing suite it's nice to have all the clients avaiable.
All in one role is updated to include the clients.
For multi, just add to test recipes to allow for flexibility.

Change-Id: I0b25363e35942e90d48bf008a9967bbe9e0fef64

subject: Cap django-pyscss <2.0.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 12:49:03.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Cap django-pyscss <2.0.0

As pointed out in
https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33 django-pyscss
2.0.0 install_requires pyScss>=1.3.4 which we currently cap at an
incompatible pyScss<1.3 instead. Make it so we install an old enough
django-pyscss to work with pyScss 1.2.x.

Change-Id: I0cde6300ee2f590beebfa8c624c22f8eaed47172
(cherry picked from commit 7da0b687622932e84a7c7859f4ce474b7062ecd3)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cap django-pyscss <2.0.0

As pointed out in
https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33 django-pyscss
2.0.0 install_requires pyScss>=1.3.4 which we currently cap at an
incompatible pyScss<1.3 instead. Make it so we install an old enough
django-pyscss to work with pyScss 1.2.x.

Change-Id: I0cde6300ee2f590beebfa8c624c22f8eaed47172
(cherry picked from commit 7da0b687622932e84a7c7859f4ce474b7062ecd3)

in different clouds. In devstack clouds it is "Member" and in
MOS clouds it is "_member_".

commit_message:
Fix creating user in keystone v3 wrapper

A "member" role should be granted to newly created user if
version 3 of keystone is used. Name of this role is different
in different clouds. In devstack clouds it is "Member" and in
MOS clouds it is "_member_".
Assing first role with "member" string in role's name.

Change-Id: I197df429b19bd625f75223207ddb3cee5caff828
Closes-Bug: #1443367

[{'created': '2015-04-23 12:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Cap django-pyscss <2.0.0

As pointed out in
https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33 django-pyscss
2.0.0 install_requires pyScss>=1.3.4 which we currently cap at an
incompatible pyScss<1.3 instead. Make it so we install an old enough
django-pyscss to work with pyScss 1.2.x.

Change-Id: I0cde6300ee2f590beebfa8c624c22f8eaed47172
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cap django-pyscss <2.0.0

As pointed out in
https://github.com/fusionbox/django-pyscss/issues/33 django-pyscss
2.0.0 install_requires pyScss>=1.3.4 which we currently cap at an
incompatible pyScss<1.3 instead. Make it so we install an old enough
django-pyscss to work with pyScss 1.2.x.

Change-Id: I0cde6300ee2f590beebfa8c624c22f8eaed47172

commit_message:
Remove OpenStack library caps for liberty

We now have a stable/kilo branch of the requirements repo, so we can
remove the caps on Oslo libraries for the liberty cycle. This change
also uncaps libraries that were managed by Oslo when the caps were
introduced, but are part of other projects now.


Change-Id: Ica92602074ef5848c6b1b61196087848b055f4f9

commit_message:
WIP: Initial stab at py34 support

Use 2to6 excluding print and isinstance since they didn't work
as intended and satisfy flake8 in both py27 and py34 envs.

Need to split this patch into several smaller ones.

blueprint heat-python34-support

Change-Id: If13c15ee0285f4df87ba2a6cca87970c29c93a7a

commit_message:
Add function that updated network_groups metadata

Because of logic that assigns vips for networks was changed in 6.1
metadata of network groups should be updated regarding those changes as
it is used for serialization of network configuration of the cluster.

Change-Id: Icab88002af0f325c609a5b193416e142427c2ccd
Closes-Bug: #1447129

commit_message:
Check bonds instead of their slave interfaces

This allows to verify bonds for deployed nodes and changes verification
algorithm for non-deployed ones.
Now bonds are passed to net_checker for deployed nodes, so it is able
to check the connectivity on bonds when they are configured
(traffic cannot be seen on slave NICs in this case, at least for linux bonds).
For non-deployed nodes slave NICs of bonds are passed to net_checker.
It is checked that at least one of slave NICs of every bond has received
test data.

Additional info (node status, node name, node bonds names and slave NICs) is
also saved into task's message to be able to process net_checker results even
when some nodes were deleted from DB during the verification. It was made to keep
compatibility with previous approach.
We could lock nodes for deletion while they are being checked but it is subject
for another discussion.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1321765
Closes-Bug: #1438945

Change-Id: I94a1beacd4c55867a5a1bfb03ac29e21eded43dc

commit_message:
Only update MTU in update code for MTU

The ML2 create_network_db was re-passing in the entire network
with extensions like vlan_transparency present that was causing
issues in the base update function it was calling.

This corrects the behavior by having it only update the MTU, which
is the only thing it was intending to update in the first place.

Change-Id: I723c5c138e0830de98f6024c7635ec65065e9346
Closes-Bug: #1446784
(cherry picked from commit f85de393c469d1e649a1c1e5ee1b683246442351)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-16 20:20:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add security groups events

Today ML2 mech drivers have no direct exposure of security groups,
and they can only infer them from the associated network/ports.
This is problematic as agentless ML2 mech drivers have no way to
intercept securitygroups events and propagate the information to
backend, or more generally, react to them.

This patch leverages the callback registry to dispatch such events
so that interested ML2 mech drivers (or any interested party) can
therefore be notified.

This patch is solely about security groups. A follow up patch will
address the remainder of securitygroup related events, such as those
for rules.

Partial-bug: #1444112

Change-Id: Ifa1d7ee9c967576f824f1129dd68e6e3abd48f5c

commit_message:
Add security groups events

ML2 mech drivers have no direct exposure to security groups,
and they can only infer them from the associated network/ports.
This is problematic as agentless ML2 mech drivers have no way of
intercepting securitygroups events and propagate the information
to their backend, or more generally, react to them.

This patch leverages the callback registry to dispatch such events
so that interested ML2 mech drivers (or any interested party like
service plugins) can be notified and react accordingly.

This patch addresses create/update/delete of security groups and
create/delete of security groups rules. Other events may be added
over time, if need be.

This patch is only about emitting the events. The actual subscription
and implementation of the event handlers will have to take place where
deemed appropriate.

Closes-bug: #1444112

Change-Id: Ifa1d7ee9c967576f824f1129dd68e6e3abd48f5c

commit_message:
Fix valueerror when ceilometer-api start

If change local language to other language(like ja), ceilometer-api
will failed to start.

This patch will remove i18 support from ceilometer/storage/__init__.py

Change-Id: I8dc7ff0921d69e64a41e588207c97548513c99ed
Closes-Bug: #1446983
(cherry picked from commit f2ab05ac3dc95981ce183277a52e8c395a4cdbeb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-13 23:39:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix addition of plugin panel to panel group

Convert panel group's panel list to a mutable type. Fixes bug where plugin
panel was not added to the configured panel group if the current panels were
given in a tuple. Also make sure that the plugin panel is not added more than
once, which was happening when Site._process_panel_configuration() is called
multiple times.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-23 03:50:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix addition of plugin panel to panel groups

A plugin panel can be part of the default panel group in a dashboard. However,
this default group does not get created if the dashboard is originally defined
with other panel groups, so the default group must be created explicitly. A
plugin panel will not get added to its configured panel group if the panel
group is also a plugin. Prevent this from happening by processing all the
plugin panel groups before the plugin panels, which also removes the need to
store the panels in the class itself. Do not add a plugin panel to a panel
group more than once, which was happening when
Site._process_panel_configuration() is called multiple times. Add a unit test
checking for duplicate panels in a panel group. Load plugin dashboards in test
settings instead of using INSTALLED_APPS and remove deprecated "dashboards" and
"default_dashboard" from test HORIZON_CONFIG.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-02-03 22:53:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix addition of plugin panel to panel groups

A plugin panel can be part of the default panel group in a dashboard. However,
this default group does not get created if the dashboard is originally defined
with some panel groups, so the default group must be created explicitly.

Additionally, a plugin panel will not get added to its configured panel group
if the panel group is also a plugin. Prevent this from happening by processing
all the plugin panel groups before the plugin panels, which also removes the
need to store the panels in the class itself.

Do not add a plugin panel to a panel group more than once, which was happening
when Site._process_panel_configuration() is called multiple times.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558

all the plugin panel groups before the plugin panels, which also removes the

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-03-03 21:05:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix addition of plugin panel to panel groups

A plugin panel can be part of the default panel group in a dashboard. However,
this default group does not get created if the dashboard is originally defined
with some panel groups, so the default group must be created explicitly.

Additionally, a plugin panel will not get added to its configured panel group
if the panel group is also a plugin. Prevent this from happening by processing
all the plugin panel groups before the plugin panels, which also removes the
need to store the panels in the class itself.

Do not add a plugin panel to a panel group more than once, which was happening
when Site._process_panel_configuration() is called multiple times.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-03-13 21:33:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix addition of plugin panel to panel group

Revert fix from bug #1329050, which adds a plugin panel to its dashboard's
class. Adding a plugin panel to a dashboard whose class has its panels defined
in a tuple will fail because the new plugin cannot be appended to the tuple.
The code errors out before the panel gets added to the dashboard's panel list.
However, at this point, the panel has already been registered with the
dashboard. This causes Dashboard.get_panels() to see the panel in its registry
but not in its panel groups. Consequently, the panel gets put in the "Other"
panel group instead of its configured one, as described in bug #1378558.

By not adding the the plugin panel to its dashboard's class, the panel gets
added to its dashboard's panel list. Now the original issue from bug #1329050
resurfaces. The root cause of that is that every time Dashboard._autodiscover()
is called, it instantiates all its panel group classes, wiping out any panels
previously added to any of the panel groups. Avoid this by always processing
all the plugin panel groups before any of the plugin panels, which also ensures
that the panel groups exist before their panels.

Making this change exposed an issue where the Horizon URLs were being loaded
twice during the plugin infrastructure's unit tests, causing plugin panels to
be added multiple times to their dashboards. Fix that by removing the second,
unnecessary call. Also add tests for the scenarios described in the two bugs
addressed here.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558

commit_message:
Fix addition of plugin panel to panel group

Revert fix from bug #1329050, which adds a plugin panel to its dashboard's
class. Adding a plugin panel to a dashboard whose class has its panels defined
in a tuple will fail because the new plugin cannot be appended to the tuple.
The code errors out before the panel gets added to the dashboard's panel list.
However, at this point, the panel has already been registered with the
dashboard. This causes Dashboard.get_panels() to see the panel in its registry
but not in its panel groups. Consequently, the panel gets put in the "Other"
panel group instead of its configured one, as described in bug #1378558.

By not adding the the plugin panel to its dashboard's class, the panel gets
added to its dashboard's panel list. Now the original issue from bug #1329050
resurfaces. The root cause of that is that every time Dashboard._autodiscover()
is called, it instantiates all its panel group classes, wiping out any panels
previously added to any of the panel groups. Avoid this by always processing
all the plugin panel groups before any of the plugin panels, which also ensures
that the panel groups exist before their panels.

Making this change exposed an issue where the Horizon URLs were being loaded
twice during the plugin infrastructure's unit tests, causing plugin panels to
be added multiple times to their dashboards. Fix that by removing the second,
unnecessary call. Also create a second test plugin panel group and panel to
test the scenarios described in the two bugs addressed here, adding two panel
groups at a time.

Change-Id: Id6a99c3ff18102c8f47431638d4dda98f14ec641
Closes-Bug: 1378558

commit_message:
rabbit: fix ipv6 support

Url constructed for kombu cannot contain ipv6 address without
brackets. The url.hostname returns hosts without brackets so
we have to readd them.

Change-Id: Ifb1d358a67655af99a84b77ca813fc2dd87d87dc
(cherry picked from commit 9f137948ae3245f2ddaf7a21eb5a570ad0c81934)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-28 09:49:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Libvirt: Fix error message when unable to preallocate image

For this error message,

LOG.error(_LE('Unable to preallocate_images=%(imgs)s at path: '
              '%(path)s'), {'imgs': CONF.preallocate_images,
                            'path': self.path})

CONF.preallocate_images can only be set to 'none' and 'space'
so if error message come out, it would be

Unable to preallocate_images=none(or space) at path: /path/to/image.
which is not correct.

Change-Id: Id122a5e1ad1d0441d6b75d081b2be3f276439a2a
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-04 00:38:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "Libvirt: Fix error message when unable to preallocate image

Change-Id: Id122a5e1ad1d0441d6b75d081b2be3f276439a2a

commit_message:
Libvirt: Fix error message when unable to preallocate image

For this error message,

LOG.error(_LE('Unable to preallocate_images=%(imgs)s at path: '
              '%(path)s'), {'imgs': CONF.preallocate_images,
                            'path': self.path})

CONF.preallocate_images can only be set to 'none' and 'space'
so if error message come out, it would be

Unable to preallocate_images=none(or space) at path: /path/to/image.
which is not correct.

Change-Id: Id122a5e1ad1d0441d6b75d081b2be3f276439a2a

commit_message:
Include supported version information

Currently the IncompatibleObjectVersion class doesn't include
the information of the supported version. This would atleast give
an idea to the operator on the maximum supported version on the
controller/conductor APIs.

This patch will print the maximum supported version information
in the exception log.

Change-Id: I5004a4173df5f556633d3547b504bda467e4426d
Closes-Bug: #1443868

commit_message:
Standardize token scoping workflow.

Currently scoping the federated tokens requires separate authentication
method 'saml2' or 'mapped'.
Thanks to patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130593/ this workflow
was standardized.
This patch handles the client side of the standardization process.

Change-Id: I36710ada99d082a359fa0d515f7e27e01c01658e

commit_message:
Use retrying decorator from oslo_db

wrap_db_retry decorator can do the same as _retry_on_deadlock
and is also capable to perform retries on application request
since version 1.5.0. So this eliminates for additional 3rd-party
library (retrying)
This patch also changes maximum retry count for db deadlocks
to 5, which makes 6 effective attempts in total.

Unit tests were adjusted accordingly.

Change-Id: I790e4640ef9cca7887718776ef4432d177aff3bb
Closes-Bug: #1439067

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver clones NFS export policy

When clustered Data ONTAP clones a flexvol, the clone gets the
NFS export policy of its parent. Manila expects the clone to be
independent of its parent, so it should be given its own export
policy. This isn't happening in the Kilo cDOT driver.

Change-Id: I5067fc5729bec62de19d1aeaed7ed60d2224e498
Closes-Bug: #1446369

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 09:33:14.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/galera_pin.pref.j2', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/templates/galera_client_pin.pref.j2', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_client/tasks/galera_client_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add release pinning to galera roles

As both Ubuntu and the MariaDB repositories carry packages with the same

Due to the OpenStack CI images having conflicting packages installed in the

commit_message:
Add release pinning to galera roles

As both Ubuntu and the MariaDB repositories carry packages with the same
names, apt package pinning is required to ensure that the packages we install
come from the right repository. This patch adds a pinning preference file to
ensure that the packages we install come from the MariaDB repository.

Due to the OpenStack CI images having conflicting packages installed in the
base image, this patch also includes the removal of these packages during the
AIO bootstrap to ensure that the deployment succeeds.

For environments where the same two packages are installed on the hosts prior
to the deployment of os-ansible-deployment, they would need to ensure that the
packages are removed first. This has been seen in environments where
monitoring tooling has installed the packages as a dependancy.

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I5ad0b9010e49832c4f866c0b141e1c035d5f9268

commit_message:
Remove known conflicting packages in the AIO bootstrap

Due to the OpenStack CI images having conflicting packages installed in the
base image, this patch also includes the removal of these packages during the
AIO bootstrap to ensure that the deployment succeeds.

For environments where the same two packages are installed on the hosts prior
to the deployment of os-ansible-deployment, they would need to ensure that the
packages are removed first. This has been seen in environments where
monitoring tooling has installed the packages as a dependancy.

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I83dda553dec9b7652d8463c426b2de6724ba78f2

Implementation of tosca.node.ObjectStorage

object store template with expected template

commit_message:
'deleted' filter does not work properly

While calling server list with deleted filter set to true/false, it
always returns deleted instances to admin, because the code didn't
convert string to boolean value. So even if we pass deleted='false'
or any string value, it always returns True.

Converted 'deleted' filter from string to its boolean value and set
default to False if called with an invalid string.

Closes-Bug: 1443890
Change-Id: I215ebbd4638c94fbabe13a5b2ab8a356204dce3c

commit_message:
Hide Cancel button if no cancel_url is provided

If there is no cancel_url is defined on the ModalFormView
class, hide the Cancel button.

Closes-Bug: #1434548

Removing HA interfaces from port list

In the network topology, HA interfaces cause inconsistent results
when trying to display the network topology.

commit_message:
Split engine service test cases (1)

This patch extracts the common functions used in engine service test
into a separate module that will be shared among sub-unit-tests.
Following patches will split the engine service tests into sub test
units.

commit_message:
Set collector settings again in case revert fails

- Collector settings are added in revert snapshot method
in order to avoid situation when after revert master node is
not started and her destroying erases all settings in container

Change-Id: Ic3817c7eb6c6d379086771fbf49ed6dbc6c4ca3d
Closes-Bug: #1442600

subject: Report correct Node capabilities to k8s
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 11:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/GetNodeCapabilities.template', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Classes/KubernetesMinionNode.yaml', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/getMemoryBytes.sh', 'Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/getCpuCoresCount.sh'], 'message': 'Report correct Node capabilities to k8s

KubernetesCluster used to report 2 CPU cores and 4GB RAM
for each Node no matter what flavor was used for the Node.

This fix adds additional step to ask VM for its real capabilities
and provide those values during Node creation

Closes-Bug: #1447386
Change-Id: I786de0b5fcf5cf094397c8c88b2f03a88326b884
(cherry picked from commit dee685beaba7270b0258c8a5be2d028ecab6d2f8)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Report correct Node capabilities to k8s

KubernetesCluster used to report 2 CPU cores and 4GB RAM
for each Node no matter what flavor was used for the Node.

This fix adds additional step to ask VM for its real capabilities
and provide those values during Node creation

Closes-Bug: #1447386
Change-Id: I786de0b5fcf5cf094397c8c88b2f03a88326b884
(cherry picked from commit dee685beaba7270b0258c8a5be2d028ecab6d2f8)

[{'created': '2015-04-16 07:17:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict subnet create/update to avoid DHCP resync

As we know, IPs in subnet CIDR are used for
1) Broadcast port
2) Gateway port
3) DHCP port if enable_dhcp is True, or changing to True
4) Others go into allocation_pools
Above 1) to 3) are created by default, which means if CIDR doesn't
have that much of IPs, subnet create/update will cause a DHCP resync.
This fix is to add some restricts to the issue:
A) When subnet create, /31 and /32 CIDR are forbidden if enable_dhcp
   is True, and,
B) When subnet update, if enable_dhcp is True, and, there is not any
   more IPs in allocation_pools, the request should be denied.

Change-Id: I2e4a4d5841b9ad908f02b7d0795cba07596c023d

commit_message:
Restrict subnet create/update to avoid DHCP resync

As we know, IPs in subnet CIDR are used for
1) Broadcast port
2) Gateway port
3) DHCP port if enable_dhcp is True, or update to True
4) Others go into allocation_pools
Above 1) to 3) are created by default, which means if CIDR doesn't
have that much of IPs, subnet create/update will cause a DHCP resync.

This fix is to add some restricts to the issue:
A) When subnet create, if enable_dhcp is True, /31 and /32
   cidrs are forbidden for IPv4 subnets while /127 and /128 cidrs are
   forbidden for IPv6 subnets.
B) When subnet update, if enable_dhcp is changing to True and there are no
   more IPs in allocation_pools, the request should be denied.

Change-Id: I2e4a4d5841b9ad908f02b7d0795cba07596c023d
Co-authored-by: Andrew Boik <dboik@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1443798

commit_message:
Fixing log messages to avoid information duplication

Currently some ids in Sahara log messages are noticed twice.
All this messages should be checked and fixed to avoid information
duplication.

partially implements bp: logs-improvement

Change-Id: I1fd3f8b76ed6f56d9e8116ea453d05246a68f7dc

subject: use message id to generate hbase unique key
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 11:02:44.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/storage/test_storage_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_hbase.py'], 'message': 'use message id to generate hbase unique key

We currently can disable computing signature for metering message,
but HBase still uses signature as a dimension to generate unique row
key, this will lead to different samples treated as same one.

Message id should be used in stead of message signature, because
id will always exist and also unique.

Change-Id: I47cdce59c9934573076cf609ce1a0c37aea75c44
Closes-Bug: #1445227
(cherry picked from commit 15a92ec1ef2ab3e6d1d187ad909a0d5800ee4a2e)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
use message id to generate hbase unique key

We currently can disable computing signature for metering message,
but HBase still uses signature as a dimension to generate unique row
key, this will lead to different samples treated as same one.

Message id should be used in stead of message signature, because
id will always exist and also unique.

Change-Id: I47cdce59c9934573076cf609ce1a0c37aea75c44
Closes-Bug: #1445227
(cherry picked from commit 15a92ec1ef2ab3e6d1d187ad909a0d5800ee4a2e)

commit_message:
Angular alert service - refactor use

Refactor horizon.alert(...) to use toastService.add(...)
You can see it if you go to new Angular Launch Instance and
Create a Key Pair. The success message
uses the new service.

Note: Legacy Horizon code still uses horizon.alert(...)

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: I51fecdd88e28987d1f7b16e26953c9645aee6326

commit_message:
HLM-514 Add packages required for config pocessor

Config config pocessor required two packages wsgiref and sh to be
added to global-requirements to allow for it to be build using the
pip mirrors.

commit_message:
Add removing old snapshots

* we keep old snapshots and this take a lot
  of space on the drive, so when generating
  snapshot starts we remove all old snapshots
* we have problem with timeouts, as a temporaly
  solution snapshot timeout have been increased

Change-Id: Ide64d5c745f9e97fe237a26d8de4f67f9cd10675
Related-Bug: #1382511

commit_message:
Fix lack PK of compute_node_stats when DB downgrade

The 'compute_node_stats' table was created when DB downgrade,
but it didn't set the 'id' colume as primary key, this would
result in nova-compute booting failed. Fix this issue and add
some test cases.

Change-Id: I44ad0b2f9def3278a6f42bbf51668a711540659b
Closes-Bug: #1410706

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 00:11:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add --all-tenants option to 'nova delete'

Currently, the all_tenants=1 search option is being passed all the
time for 'nova delete' commands in order to enable 'nova delete' by
name to work across tenants, for those that have all_tenants access
in the nova policy.json. This however breaks all 'nova delete' for
non-admins when policy has been configured to allow only admin to
list servers across all_tenants.

This patch changes 'nova delete' to take an option --all-tenants to
get the functionality to delete by name across tenants. This is
similar to how 'nova list --all-tenants' works.

Closes-Bug: #1439381

Change-Id: I204daaf5c0f4dab7c93ef0bd85ffab3529ca352a

commit_message:
Add --all-tenants option to 'nova delete'

Currently, the all_tenants=1 search option is being passed all the
time for 'nova delete' commands in order to enable 'nova delete' by
name to work across tenants, for those that have all_tenants access
in the nova policy.json. This however breaks all 'nova delete' for
non-admins when policy has been configured to allow only admin to
list servers across all_tenants.

This patch changes 'nova delete' to take an option --all-tenants to
get the functionality to delete by name across tenants. This is
similar to how 'nova list --all-tenants' works.

Closes-Bug: #1439381

Change-Id: I204daaf5c0f4dab7c93ef0bd85ffab3529ca352a

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 14027, 'name': 'Michal Rostecki', 'email': 'mrostecki@suse.de', 'username': 'mrostecki'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-03 09:03:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle binary userdata files such as gzip

The current code in the servers api assumes only text files will be
provided as userdata. That is, the data is utf-8 encoded before it
is base64 encoded and sent. This breaks for binary userdata files,
(example, gzip files) as they can't be utf-8 encoded.

This change ignores specifically the exceptions that are raised
when utf-8 encoding is attempted on non-text data: AttributeError
and UnicodeDecodeError. These exceptions will be ignored to let
binary files proceed to the base64 encoding step.

Closes-Bug: #1419859

Change-Id: Ie96283f6ff892ae30485722cf7c3ec40f3f1b5df
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-03 09:19:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle binary userdata files such as gzip

This change ignores specifically the exceptions that are raised

and UnicodeDecodeError. These exceptions will be ignored to let
binary files proceed to the base64 encoding step.

Closes-Bug: #1419859

Change-Id: Ie96283f6ff892ae30485722cf7c3ec40f3f1b5df

(example, gzip files) as they can't be utf-8 encoded.

This change ignores specifically the exceptions that are raised

and UnicodeDecodeError. These exceptions will be ignored to let
binary files proceed to the base64 encoding step.

Closes-Bug: #1419859

Change-Id: Ie96283f6ff892ae30485722cf7c3ec40f3f1b5df
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Handle binary userdata files such as gzip

The current code in the servers api assumes only text files will be
provided as userdata. That is, the data is utf-8 encoded before it
is base64 encoded and sent. This breaks for binary userdata files,
(example, gzip files) as they can't be utf-8 encoded.

This change ignores specifically the exceptions that are raised
when utf-8 encoding is attempted on non-text data: AttributeError
and UnicodeDecodeError. These exceptions will be ignored to let
binary files proceed to the base64 encoding step.

Closes-Bug: #1419859

Change-Id: Ie96283f6ff892ae30485722cf7c3ec40f3f1b5df

commit_message:
service child process normal SIGTERM exit

service.py had some code where the child process would catch the
SIGTERM from the parent just so it could exit with 1 status rather
than with an indication that it exited due to SIGTERM. When
shutting down the parent doesn't care in what way the child ended,
only that they're all gone, so this code is unnecessary.

Also, for some reason this caused the child to never exit while
there was an open connection from a client. Probably something
with eventlet and signal handling.

This is a cherry-pick of oslo-incubator commit
702bc569987854b602ef189655c201c348de84cb .

Change-Id: I87f3ca4da64fb8070e4d6c3876a2f1ce1a3ca71d
Closes-Bug: #1446583
(cherry picked from commit d73ac96d18c66aa4dd5b7d7f8d7c22e8f8434683)

commit_message:
rabbit: fix ipv6 support

Url constructed for kombu cannot contain ipv6 address without
brackets. The url.hostname returns hosts without brackets so
we have to readd them.

Change-Id: Ifb1d358a67655af99a84b77ca813fc2dd87d87dc

commit_message:
Report correct Node capabilities to k8s

KubernetesCluster used to report 2 CPU cores and 4GB RAM
for each Node no matter what flavor was used for the Node.

This fix adds additional step to ask VM for its real capabilities
and provide those values during Node creation

Closes-Bug: #1447386
Change-Id: I786de0b5fcf5cf094397c8c88b2f03a88326b884

commit_message:
Integration test with vCenter Glance, vlan manager and CephOSD.

Scenario
1. Create cluster with vCenter support
2. Add 3 nodes with controller roles
3. Add a node with Cinder role and ceph-osd
4. Add a node with vCinder role and ceph-osd
5. Set Nova-Network VlanManager as a network backend
6. Deploy the cluster
7. Run network verification
8. Run OSTF

Change-Id: I0938ef71f9d5c97471f4000a44eae305e29f4125
Closes-bug: #1444614

commit_message:
Fix a bug about next_index property of cluster

Remove cluster_get_next_index method from db_api since we don't
need it anymore. Now we directly use db_api.cluster_get to fetch
the next_index value of a cluster.

Now cluster's next_index property will only be changed when
the following two methods are invoked:
1. db_api.node_create
2. db_api.node_migrate

Change-Id: I4361955cff18070200a97bd246ea7e9ddd330141
Closes-Bug: #1447468

pageview) are redirected precisely. Then ensures folder
redirect with matching HTML file name which should

commit_message:
Use gerrit reference to clone networking-midonet

Devstack plugin and Neutron plugin belong to the same repository
(http://github.com/stackforge/networking-midonet), so when a new patch
is submitted, we have to clone the gerrit reference and branch to test
what we are actually submitting, otherwise we always clone master branch
of the already merged patches.

Change-Id: I465f7dea634227c85aa6311b5f8b865e571a08a8

commit_message:
Fix elements installation

Mimic the install directory used in diskimage-builder, with the actual
elements under a "elements" subdirectory. This is also what the
sahara-image-create script expects, as it appends "elements" to any of
the probed paths.

Change-Id: I1068623b2d76720b409024ac2a36e5327150b181

commit_message:
Remove ironic compute driver and sched manager

This removes the deprecated ironic compute driver and scheduler
manager. The compute driver and scheduler manager have been in
nova's tree since Juno and this was to have been deprecated in
the Kilo release. It is now Liberty, so it is about time :)

DocImpact

Change-Id: I8c3c35ca5a9a163e689a4c856b1efd557779b9fb

commit_message:
Control create/delete flavor api permissions using policy.json

The permissions of create/delete flavor api is currently broken
and expects the user to be always an admin, instead of controlling
the permissions by the rules defined in the nova policy.json.

Change-Id: Ide3c9ec2fa674b4fe3ea9d935cd4f7848914b82e
Closes-Bug: 1445335
(cherry picked from commit ced60b1d1b1608dc8229741b207a95498bc0b212)

subject: Fix ResourceGroup validate when there are removal_policies
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 06:49:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_resource_group.py'], 'message': "Fix ResourceGroup validate when there are removal_policies

We can't call child_template() from a validate in ResourceGroup
as it accesses nested(). So move the validation to validate_nested_stack()
so we can control the test template used for validation.

Unfortunately coverage for this got removed during recent test rework
and it looks like the interface has got broken.

Co-Authored-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibea738a343847736b041cc49a2c486fa71e562d9
Closes-Bug: #1446861
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix ResourceGroup validate when there are removal_policies

We can't call child_template() from a validate in ResourceGroup
as it accesses nested(). So move the validation to validate_nested_stack()
so we can control the test template used for validation.

Unfortunately coverage for this got removed during recent test rework
and it looks like the interface has got broken.

Co-Authored-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibea738a343847736b041cc49a2c486fa71e562d9

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Note: This is part of importing of translations, there are no new
translations for this project, thus only the pot file gets updated.

Change-Id: Ib472c156a7007b2166c6857ae1fa2bb72a2e0c1a

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: I0e9ef00182a2229602d23b8a67a02f0be62ee239

commit_message:
Adds style recommendations for writing Plugin Guides

Third-party developers can create their own plugins
for Fuel. Nevertheless, certification process
means sending a package of documentation and the plugin
itself.
To simplify the process of writing Plugin Guides,
let's provide style recommendations.

Change-Id: Ie99c7d525a6ba501067bb9b458935cf79cfe3684

commit_message:
Package definitions pagination update and improvement

Before has_prev_data always returned False, because of which prev data
link was never shown.
This commit adds mechanism for next/prev link generation/detection.
Also includes minor wording/translation updates of Pakcage Definitions
table.

Change-Id: Ic45ed4386f66d9dadea5b931df81aa329fce3aba
Closes-Bug: #1445140

commit_message:
Package definitions pagination update and improvement

Before has_prev_data always returned False, because of which prev data
link was never shown.
This commit adds mechanism for next/prev link generation/detection.
Also includes minor wording/translation updates of Pakcage Definitions
table.

Closes-Bug: #1445140

subject: Update README to work with release tools
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 15:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': 'Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

Change-Id: I37e0acc5ed8e1af565359290fa622456901c735e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-09 17:02:44.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Double functional testing timeout to 180s

The increase in ovs testing is resulting in job failure due to
timeouts in test_killed_monitor_respawns.  Giving the test more
time to complete should reduce the failure rate.

Change-Id: I2ba9b1eb388bfbbebbd6b0f3edb6d5a5ae0bfead
Closes-Bug: #1442272
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Double functional testing timeout to 180s

The increase in ovs testing is resulting in job failure due to
timeouts in test_killed_monitor_respawns.  Giving the test more
time to complete should reduce the failure rate.

Change-Id: I2ba9b1eb388bfbbebbd6b0f3edb6d5a5ae0bfead
Closes-Bug: #1442272

subject: Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"""
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 13:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"""

commit_message:
Add additional validation for fip properties

Additional validation to throw an eror if fixed IP is specified
without the port id.

If you intend to associate the floating IP with a fixed IP during
create/update, then you must indicate the identifier of the
internal port.

Change-Id: I99eb0f2949d93a8619fc03cd4c8861133afaf9ae

commit_message:
Adds a note about LACP L2 bonds exluded from net verification

LACP L2 bonds are mistaken for simple interfaces by
network checker. This commit provides a note
about LACP bonds excluded from the checklist to the
User Guide, into Verify Networks section.

Change-Id: I8899d7eea02f848cf76401265cf65cc6091284d6
Closes-Bug: 1445352

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 23:56:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove dependency on weak reference for registry callbacks

The use of weakref was introduced as a preventive measure to avoid
potential OOM kills, however that limited our ability to employ
certain functions as callbacks, such as object methods (see [1] for
an example).

Since the adoption of the callback registry, it has been observed that
callbacks are generally long lived (for the entire duration of the
process they belong to), therefore this limitation appears to be too
restrictive at this point in time.

Some might argue that it's better safe than sorry, but until we
have some evidence of actual OOM kills, it's probably best to take
the bolder action of removing the adoption of weak references and
deal with the potential fallout, should it happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175179/

Change-Id: Idcd0286fc4235af82901c8a17ea45bc758b62b37
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-22 21:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/callbacks/manager.py', 'doc/source/devref/callbacks.rst'], 'message': "Remove dependency on weak reference for registry callbacks

The use of weakref was introduced as a preventive measure to avoid
potential OOM kills, however that limited our ability to employ
certain functions as callbacks, such as object methods (see [1] for
an example).

Since the adoption of the callback registry, it has been observed that
callbacks are generally long lived (for the entire duration of the
process they belong to), therefore this limitation appears to be too
restrictive at this point in time.

Some might argue that it's better safe than sorry, but until we
have some evidence of actual OOM kills, it's probably best to take
the bolder action of removing the adoption of weak references and
deal with the potential fallout, should it happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175179/

Change-Id: Idcd0286fc4235af82901c8a17ea45bc758b62b37
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on weak reference for registry callbacks

The use of weakref was introduced as a preventive measure to avoid
potential OOM kills, however that limited our ability to employ
certain functions as callbacks, such as object methods (see [1] for
an example).

Since the adoption of the callback registry, it has been observed that
callbacks are generally long lived (for the entire duration of the
process they belong to), therefore this limitation appears to be too
restrictive at this point in time.

Some might argue that it's better safe than sorry, but until we
have some evidence of actual OOM kills, it's probably best to take
the bolder action of removing the adoption of weak references and
deal with the potential fallout, should it happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175179/

Change-Id: Idcd0286fc4235af82901c8a17ea45bc758b62b37

commit_message:
Set auth_encryption_key option to be secret

To avoid exposure in the logs, auth_encryption_key from heat.conf
should be marked secret.

Closes-Bug: #1446408

commit_message:
added network id field in admin's update network model

In admin's update network model, only name field is shown.
Since duplicate name is allowed, it is difficult to differentiate the two with same name.
This patch adding the readonly text input to show the network id.

Change-Id: I95291f5b36a5d3d4f76db7b48233eca1f4b958ff
Closes-Bug: #1443265

commit_message:
Ensure metadata network works with DVR

As DVR routers use a different type of interface, this patch
amends the DHCP agent code ensuring that a metadata proxy is
spawned when the metadata network feature is enabled on the
DHCP agent.

Change-Id: Id7f2e891c0753620a604cf6160c6b592db1aa284
Closes-Bug: #1447344

commit_message:
Fix ResourceGroup validate when there are removal_policies

We can't call child_template() from a validate in ResourceGroup
as it accesses nested(). So move the validation to validate_nested_stack()
so we can control the test template used for validation.

Unfortunately coverage for this got removed during recent test rework
and it looks like the interface has got broken.

Co-Authored-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibea738a343847736b041cc49a2c486fa71e562d9
Closes-Bug: #1446861

commit_message:
Remove [Service] section from mongo config tmpl

The mongodb guest wasn't starting up on Ubuntu or Fedora
due to the presense of a [Service] section in /etc/mongodb.conf.
I believe this section was not intended for config.template but
should be in the systemd script for mongo. For now, we will
revert this change and consider a better way to fix it for
Liberty.

The change that introduced this is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150131

Cherry-pick of 31fe90a6a899cab4751b1947823ef138869c1fe5 from master
Change-Id: I090c95185f732485a21f6d38df1655e205a07224
Closes-bug: 1446735

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Note: This is part of importing of translations, there are no new

Change-Id: Ia187bb71df998908c40281f71003d7cf3d092dd2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Note: This is part of importing of translations, there are no new
translations for this project, thus only the pot file gets updated.

Change-Id: Ia187bb71df998908c40281f71003d7cf3d092dd2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-03 01:11:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added support for OSProfiler in redstack

A flag (ENABLE_PROFILER) was added to redstack.rc that controls
whether OSProfiler is enabled.  Since this depends on Ceilometer,
Ceilometer is also installed if set to true.

Several configuration variables were added as well to redstack.rc
that can be used to control the behaviour of the profiler.

ENABLE_PROFILER is set to 'false' by default, but can be turned
on easily by adding 'ENABLE_PROFILER=true' to options.rc or by
the command line 'ENABLE_PROFILER=true ./redstack install'.

Change-Id: I981809d5c5fd5ac9a7d72713e90d93845fc3a747
Related-Bug: #1421859

commit_message:
Added support for OSProfiler in redstack

A flag (ENABLE_PROFILER) was added to redstack.rc that controls
whether OSProfiler is enabled.  Since this depends on Ceilometer,
Ceilometer is also installed if set to true.

Several configuration variables were added as well to redstack.rc
that can be used to control the behaviour of the profiler.

ENABLE_PROFILER is set to 'false' by default, but can be turned
on easily by adding 'ENABLE_PROFILER=true' to options.rc or by
the command line 'ENABLE_PROFILER=true ./redstack install'.

Change-Id: I981809d5c5fd5ac9a7d72713e90d93845fc3a747
Related-Bug: #1421859

subject: Implement higher priority for mariadb packages
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 16:12:14.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/galera_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/container_common/tasks/container_packages.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/tasks/repos.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/templates/mariadb-priority'], 'message': 'Implement higher priority for mariadb packages

The current pin priority does not force apt to switch packages that are
already installed to the appropriate MariaDB packages. This results in
deployment failures when other packages like mysql-common happen to be
deployed on the host already for whatever reason.

This patch sets the pin-priority to 1001 which tells apt that the conflicting
package should be replaced, even if it requires a downgrade.

This patch also sets all apt package installation tasks to force the
installation in order to facilitate the downgrade where necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I30b86b4f0c1f736c692db95ec2f7981dbe31917f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Implement higher priority for mariadb packages

The current pin priority does not force apt to switch packages that are
already installed to the appropriate MariaDB packages. This results in
deployment failures when other packages like mysql-common happen to be
deployed on the host already for whatever reason.

This patch sets the pin-priority to 1001 which tells apt that the conflicting
package should be replaced, even if it requires a downgrade.

This patch also sets all apt package installation tasks to force the
installation in order to facilitate the downgrade where necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1446772
Change-Id: I30b86b4f0c1f736c692db95ec2f7981dbe31917f

commit_message:
Fix floatingip[association] misses use case

Make floatingip_id optional in OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation
so that heat will select an available floating IP from pool by
default.

Change-Id: I15f2964dbf122f8247dd50b1f0c2a11d6fa836eb
Closes-Bug: #1430483

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2014-10-25 19:30:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure Puppet CM for SSL in OpenStack deployment.

Add the option ssl crt to the bind parameter in the ha config to use
SSL for openstack services that expose public API.

To enable ssl for public endpoint you need to:
  - set ssl_public_endpoint = true
    + available in openstack/manifest/all.pp
    + and in opentstack/manifest/controller.pp
  - set ssl_certificate = "/etc/haproxy/cert.pem"
    + in openstack/manifests/ha/haproxy.pp use
        class { 'openstack::ha::glance':
            ssl_certificate = "/etc/haproxy/cert.pem"
        }
      and the same for other services.

TODO: Other modifications are needed in
osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_{ha, simple}.pp to set the certificate from
astute.yaml file.

Some services need to be configured to support SSL:
- Horizon: OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE = "internalURL"
- Keystone: Use https instead of http for public url

Change-Id: Ie2a108413f9baa6e38cd418ae530946c957dd3cb
Implements: blueprint ssl-endpoints

commit_message:
Ensure Puppet CM for SSL in OpenStack deployment.

Add the option ssl crt to the bind parameter in the ha config to use
SSL for openstack services that expose public API.

To enable ssl for public endpoint you need to:
  - set ssl_public_endpoint = true
    + available in openstack/manifest/all.pp
    + and in opentstack/manifest/controller.pp
  - set ssl_certificate = "/etc/haproxy/cert.pem"
    + in openstack/manifests/ha/haproxy.pp use
        class { 'openstack::ha::glance':
            ssl_certificate = "/etc/haproxy/cert.pem"
        }
      and the same for other services.

TODO: Other modifications are needed in
osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_{ha, simple}.pp to set the certificate from
astute.yaml file.

Some services need to be configured to support SSL:
- Horizon: OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE = "internalURL"
- Keystone: Use https instead of http for public url

Change-Id: Ie2a108413f9baa6e38cd418ae530946c957dd3cb
Implements: blueprint ssl-endpoints

commit_message:
Sync haproxy 0.5.0 module from puppetslab.

Version 0.5.0 adds bind_options parameter to haproxy::listen
that is required to enable SSL termination on HAProxy.

Change-Id: Ie1c309ff38eeff2d2861e2ba26a318f3d7504a37
Implements: blueprint merge-openstack-puppet-modules

commit_message:
Fix failure with get on dict that was None

When calling get_acl_dict_for_user() in the RBAC feature, the user list
may be empty.  In this case, make sure an empty list (not None) is
returned so the receiving code won't fail.

Change-Id: I6aeb94e03aa7898823ec408807180f7eeb2d2916
Closes-bug: #1446826

commit_message:
Prevent html page caching by default

Caching html pages could be a security vulnerability, so
by default prevent this from happening.
For now just a simple on/off switch, if more flexibility is needed
here it can be added later.

Change-Id: Iccf65edee23d55b016201b643c0d187d04ff3c13
Closes-Bug: #1446701

commit_message:
Change Magnum's bandit gate

Change Magnum's bandit gate from an experiemtnal non-voting
gate into a non-voting check.  The objective is to get
the gate to run on each commit and eventually make it
voting around middle of May.

Change-Id: I3150e5c527656f72222bd0cf225742f5d75779a5

commit_message:
Conform to update of the cookbook-openstack-client

Berksfile is updated, because the cookbook-openstack-client is updated.
The update to be need to change Berksfile are following.
1. The name of cookbook was changed from "openstack-client" to
"openstack_client"
2. The dependency version of yum increased than 3.5.2, client cookbook requires 3.5.4.

Change-Id: I6393c815339800fdf0b2ca7c99d4c87caa176398
Closes-bug: #1447229

commit_message:
Proper lbaas VIP create validation

Improve lbaas code with the following modifications:

* Proper validation on subnet for VIP creation
* More thorough unit tests
* Remove db_util and move the methods to the appropriate

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-19 14:22:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ignore the down host when populates hosts of server group

This patch ignores the host that down or disable when populates
hosts for server group. Because when the host is down/disable,
for deploying instance that belongs to server group with affinity
policy and other instances with same server group on the down/disable
host, the scheduling will fail. Because scheduler is trying to find
same host for the new instance.

This is also for after we honors the server group when evacuate,
if the instance is in server group with affinity policy, and other
instances with same server group on the down/disabled host, then
the instance can't be evacuated to another host.

Change-Id: I62d8c3af247b747ff5850684dbd9b085580dfa59
Closes-Bug: #1394219

This patch ignores the down host when populates hosts for server
group. Because when the host is down, for deploying instance that belongs
to server group with affinity policy and other instances with same server
group on the down host, the scheduling will fail. Because scheduler is
trying to find same host for the new instance.

if the instance is in server group with affinity policy, and other

can't evacuate instance to another host. That means with affinity

affinity policy case.

commit_message:
Ignores the down host when populates hosts of server group

This patch ignores the down host when populates hosts for server
group. Because when the host is down, for deploying instance that belongs
to server group with affinity policy and other instances with same server
group on the down host, the scheduling will fail. Because scheduler is
trying to find same host for the new instance.

This is also for after we honors the server group when evacuate,
if the instance is in server group with affinity policy, and other
instances with same server group on the down host, then operator
can't evacuate instance to another host. That means with affinity
policy will lose the VM HA, this patch adds that ability back for
affinity policy case.

Change-Id: I62d8c3af247b747ff5850684dbd9b085580dfa59
Closes-Bug: #1394219

commit_message:
Fix duplicate stable acl config in python-glanceclient

Change Ibff756e2f93179f2e6979ba9d784fbfcaff3651d added the stable acl
config, but then change I6fb79132d954c8cccdbd0c0584aa7acbe4655fef has
merged and we now have duplicate entries.  This is making the
project-config-gerrit change fail.

I think this got through because it's a check job and
I6fb79132d954c8cccdbd0c0584aa7acbe4655fef was around for a long
time before it got merged.

Change-Id: Ia37ec5071591cd8c772f9ce806cfda6154df7c81

commit_message:
Pass stack id to init stacklock

Only acquire() function in stacklock needs to load whole stack,
other function only needs stack id. This patch only pass
stack id for stacklock so that in some place we don't need
to load whole stack.

Change-Id: Iaad5f4a871f925c4052d159a5d95184681d5bd28
Closes-Bug: #1441972

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 19:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Only update MTU in update code for MTU

The ML2 create_network_db was re-passing in the entire network
with extensions like vlan_transparency present that was causing
issues in the base update function it was calling.

This corrects the behavior by having it only update the MTU, which
is the only thing it was intending to update in the first place.

Change-Id: I723c5c138e0830de98f6024c7635ec65065e9346
Closes-Bug: #1446784
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only update MTU in update code for MTU

The ML2 create_network_db was re-passing in the entire network
with extensions like vlan_transparency present that was causing
issues in the base update function it was calling.

This corrects the behavior by having it only update the MTU, which
is the only thing it was intending to update in the first place.

Change-Id: I723c5c138e0830de98f6024c7635ec65065e9346
Closes-Bug: #1446784

commit_message:
Revert "Move rabbit/kombu settings to oslo_messaging_rabbit section"

This reverts commit 07007e791f941af6eadc7cd41dd57158983ce109.

Kilo deprecates these settings, but they still work. We should wait to
merge this until upstream distro packages are ready so that master is
not broken.

Change-Id: I691d2915196558085ffeb5ebee7f8816a22a6482

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make retry message more descriptive

When neutron fails the neutron client is often very helpful in
describing the issue. This message should not be hidden in a debug
statement, we should be able to see it easily since it is often easy to
fix. This patch removes the debug output and puts the error message in
the notice.

Change-Id: Ic7769ba463bca22af8c5b1ebc9c43e2b25a0ca99
